intro: Trimezia fistulosa, commonly known as the white-flowered trimezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, grassy foliage that grows in dense clumps, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Trimezia fistulosa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
